Description: Small fragment of a seal-impression made of fine brown Nile clay that was hardened after excavation and shows darker discolouration and a partly glossy surface (at the rear). The rear shows two sides with string impressions two and one impression of a turned cord with a width of 0.1 and 0.2 cm. The front side is only preserved in a small part, here it is flat running down towards the edges that are covered with finger impressions and shows part of an oval scarab-like seal-impression. The motif shows a standing figure at the right wearing the double crown (Amun), holding hands with probably another god or the king standing in front of him.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Amara West (Nubia), E14.7 temple magazine
Acquisition notes: Formerly housed by the Birmingham Museum and Art Gallery and the EES London.
